title: 1400-E
statement: E. Clear the Multisettime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou have a multiset containing several integers. Initially, it contains $$$a_1$$$ elements equal to $$$1$$$, $$$a_2$$$ elements equal to $$$2$$$, ..., $$$a_n$$$ elements equal to $$$n$$$.You may apply two types of operations:choose two integers $$$l$$$ and $$$r$$$ ($$$l \\le r$$$), then remove one occurrence of $$$l$$$, one occurrence of $$$l + 1$$$, ..., one occurrence of $$$r$$$ from the multiset. This operation can be applied only if each number from $$$l$$$ to $$$r$$$ occurs at least once in the multiset;choose two integers $$$i$$$ and $$$x$$$ ($$$x \\ge 1$$$), then remove $$$x$$$ occurrences of $$$i$$$ from the multiset. This operation can be applied only if the multiset contains at least $$$x$$$ occurrences of $$$i$$$.What is the minimum number of operations required to delete all elements from the multiset?InputThe first line contains one integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\le n \\le 5000$$$).The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1$$$, $$$a_2$$$, ..., $$$a_n$$$ ($$$0 \\le a_i \\le 10^9$$$).OutputPrint one integer â€” the minimum number of operations required to delete all elements from the multiset.ExamplesInput4 1 4 1 1Output2Input5 1 0 1 0 1Output3

processed.result:
You have a set of numbers. The set contains:

* $a_1$ numbers equal to 1
* $a_2$ numbers equal to 2
* ...
* $a_n$ numbers equal to $n$

You can perform two types of operations:

1. **Remove a range:** Choose two numbers, $l$ and $r$ ($l \le r$). Remove one occurrence of each number from $l$ to $r$ from the set. This can only be done if the set contains at least one occurrence of each number from $l$ to $r$.
2. **Remove a specific number:** Choose a number $i$ and a count $x$ ($x \ge 1$). Remove $x$ occurrences of the number $i$ from the set. This can only be done if the set contains at least $x$ occurrences of $i$.

What is the minimum number of operations needed to remove all numbers from the set?

You have a collection of numbers. You can remove groups of consecutive numbers from the collection, or remove a specific number multiple times, as long as you have enough of that number. What is the fewest operations needed to remove all numbers from the collection?
